Text: The Prospect Plaza Houses was a 4.53 acre complex owned by the New York City Housing Authority in the Ocean Hill section of Brooklyn.
Triplets:<The Prospect Plaza Houses
1:
--------------------
Text: Prospect Plaza Houses:  It had four buildings, 12 and 15-stories tall with 368 apartments.
Triplets:<Prospect Plaza Houses
2:
--------------------
Text: Prospect Plaza Houses:  Completed June 30, 1974, it is bordered by St. Marks and Sterling Place, Howard and Saratoga Avenues.
Triplets:<Prospect Plaza Houses
3:
--------------------
Text: Prospect Plaza Houses:  At one time the residents numbered approximately 1,171 residents.
Triplets:<Prospect Plaza Houses
5:
--------------------
Text: Prospect Plaza Houses:  Many residents left after signing a deal under a plan called HOPE VI.
Triplets:<Prospect Plaza Houses
7:
--------------------
<Text: Prospect Plaza Houses:  Many of these residents were instead given vouchers to alternative Section 8 housing.>
Triplets:<Prospect Plaza Houses
